metadata.title: CVE-2018-12406 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 63. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these couldbe exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox <64.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
